emergencies.title: Emergencies
emergencies.createDescription: Report an emergency that will be registered on blockchain
emergencies.provideDescription: Please provide a description of the emergency
emergencies.gpsErrorDesc: Please make sure GPS is enabled
emergencies.gpsAuto: Will be obtained automatically when creating the emergency

detail.title: Emergency
detail.noIdentity: No identity found registered on PeopleChain
detail.name: Name

onboarding.description: Your secure and private cryptographic wallet for emergencies
onboarding.whatIs: Emergency Wallet is a blockchain application designed to detect, manage, and respond to emergencies in real-time. It monitors the blockchain for emergency calls, indexes critical events, and allows you to create and manage your own emergencies securely and in a decentralized manner.
onboarding.recoveryPhraseDesc: Save these 12 words in a safe place. You will need this phrase to recover your account if you lose access to this device.
onboarding.passwordDesc: Create a secure password to protect your account. This password will be used to unlock your wallet.
onboarding.nonCustodial: Emergency Wallet is a non-custodial application. You are solely responsible for your private keys and funds.
onboarding.saveRecovery: Save your recovery phrase (mnemonic) in a safe place
onboarding.neverShare: Never share your recovery phrase with anyone
onboarding.losePhrase: If you lose your recovery phrase, you will permanently lose access to your funds
onboarding.noRecovery: There is no way to recover your account without the recovery phrase

unlock.title: Unlock Emergency Wallet
unlock.description: Enter your password to access your wallet
unlock.backupNote: If you just imported a backup, use the password you used when exporting the backup.
unlock.webauthnError: Error authenticating with WebAuthn. Accounts may be encrypted with password. Please try unlocking with password instead.
unlock.webauthnDescription: Use your biometric authentication or hardware key to unlock

settings.title: Settings
settings.legalInfoDesc: Terms and Conditions, and Privacy Notice

about.title: About
about.appDescription: Emergency Wallet is a blockchain application designed to detect, manage, and respond to emergencies in real-time. It monitors the blockchain for emergency calls, indexes critical events, and allows you to create and manage your own emergencies securely and in a decentralized manner.
about.legalInfoDesc: Terms and Conditions, and Privacy Notice

terms.acceptanceDesc: By accessing and using Emergency Wallet, you agree to comply with these Terms and Conditions. If you do not agree with any part of these terms, you must not use the application.
terms.serviceDesc: Emergency Wallet is a non-custodial application that allows users to:
terms.responsibilityKeys: Private Keys: You are solely responsible for the security of your private keys. Emergency Wallet does not store or have access to your private keys. If you lose your private keys or recovery phrase, you will permanently lose access to your funds and data.
terms.responsibilityUse: Appropriate Use: You agree to use Emergency Wallet legally and ethically. You will not use the application for illegal or fraudulent activities.
terms.responsibilityVerify: Information Verification: You are responsible for verifying all information before making transactions or creating emergencies.
terms.liabilityDesc: Emergency Wallet is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. We will not be responsible for:
terms.liabilityList1: Loss of funds due to loss of private keys
terms.liabilityList2: Errors in transactions made by the user
terms.liabilityList4: Damages arising from use or inability to use the application
terms.modificationsDesc: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Changes will take effect when published in the application. It is your responsibility to periodically review these terms.
terms.intellectualDesc: All intellectual property rights of Emergency Wallet, including but not limited to code, design, logos, and documentation, are owned by their respective owners.
terms.contactDesc: If you have questions about these Terms and Conditions, you can contact us through Emergency Wallet's official channels.

privacy.infoLocal: Locally Stored Information: Emergency Wallet stores all information locally on your device. This includes:
privacy.infoBlockchain: Blockchain Information: The application queries public blockchain information but does not store or transmit personally identifiable information.
privacy.infoUseDesc: All information is used exclusively for:
privacy.storageLocal: Local Storage: All information is stored locally on your device using IndexedDB and encrypted storage. No information is transmitted to external servers.
privacy.storageEncryption: Encryption: Private keys and sensitive data are encrypted using industry standards before storage.
privacy.storageNoServers: No Centralized Servers: Emergency Wallet does not use centralized servers to store personal information. Everything remains on your device.
privacy.sharingNoShare: We Do Not Share Information: Emergency Wallet does not share, sell, or transmit your personal information to third parties. All information remains on your device.
privacy.sharingBlockchain: Public Blockchain Information: Transactions and emergencies you create on blockchain are public by nature of blockchain technology. This information is visible to anyone who queries the blockchain.
privacy.rightsList2: Export your data at any time
privacy.rightsList3: Delete all your data from the application
privacy.rightsList4: Control what information you share on blockchain
privacy.cookiesDesc: Emergency Wallet does not use cookies or tracking technologies. All functionality is based on browser local storage.
privacy.changesDesc: We may update this Privacy Notice occasionally. We will notify you of significant changes through the application. The "Last updated" date indicates when the last review was made.
privacy.contactDesc: If you have questions about this Privacy Notice or how we handle your information, you can contact us through Emergency Wallet's official channels.

transactions.title: Transactions
transactions.noTransactionsDesc: You haven't made any transactions yet

radioMonitor.title: Blockchain Radio
radioMonitor.notificationsDeniedManual: Permissions denied - Enable manually in settings
radioMonitor.serviceDisabled: Service disabled. Press "Turn On Service" to activate.
radioMonitor.noEventsDesc: Events will appear here in real-time
radioMonitor.notificationsNotSupported: Your browser does not support notifications
radioMonitor.notificationsGrantedDesc: You will receive notifications when emergencies are detected
radioMonitor.notificationsDeniedDesc: You can enable them manually in your browser settings
radioMonitor.emergencyDetailsDesc: Complete information of the emergency detected on blockchain
radioMonitor.name: Name
radioMonitor.noRemarkContent: The remark content is not available. This may be due to:
radioMonitor.noRemarkReason3: The remark is empty or does not contain valid data
radioMonitor.validEmergencyFormat: This remark contains emergency data in valid format
radioMonitor.checkConsole: If it doesn't appear saved, check the console logs to see if there was an error processing it.
radioMonitor.noEmergencyPrefix: This remark does not have the EMERGENCY: prefix, so it will not be processed as an emergency.
radioMonitor.checkConsoleDetails: Check the console logs for more details.
radioMonitor.emergencyNote: If this emergency meets the EMERGENCY: format, it should be saved automatically. If it doesn't appear after a few seconds, check the console logs.
radioMonitor.emergencyDetectedNotSaved: Emergency detected but not yet saved
radioMonitor.emergencyProcessing: The emergency may still be processing. Try reloading in a few seconds.

keyring.unlockedDesc: Your accounts are loaded and available for cryptographic operations
keyring.lockNote: When locked, private keys will be removed from memory
keyring.noAccounts: No stored accounts. Unlock the keyring to create your first account
keyring.unlockWithPasswordDesc: Enter your password to load your stored accounts
keyring.unlockWithBiometric: Use biometric authentication or password to load your stored accounts
keyring.passwordAnyPlaceholder: Password (any, to unlock and create your first account)
keyring.securityNote: Security: Private keys are encrypted and stored locally in IndexedDB. You can use password or biometric authentication (WebAuthn) to unlock.
keyring.noAccountsNote: Note: Since there are no stored accounts, you can use any password to unlock. This password will be used to encrypt your first account when you create it.

webauthn.title: WebAuthn Credentials
webauthn.description: Manage your biometric authentication or PIN credentials
webauthn.notAvailable: WebAuthn is not available on this browser or device. WebAuthn requires a modern browser with support for the Web Authentication API.
webauthn.biometricSupported: Your device supports biometric authentication (fingerprint, facial recognition, PIN, etc.)
webauthn.registerDesc: Register a new WebAuthn credential to unlock your wallet without password
webauthn.credentialNameHelp: A descriptive name to identify this credential (e.g., "Fingerprint", "Windows Hello PIN")
webauthn.registerHelp: You will be asked to use your fingerprint, facial recognition, PIN, or security key to complete registration. In Windows Hello, you can use PIN without USB hardware.
webauthn.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the credential "{name}"?
webauthn.registerSuccess: WebAuthn credential registered successfully. You can now use it to unlock your wallet.
webauthn.notAvailableError: WebAuthn is not available on this browser
webauthn.noCredentials: No WebAuthn credentials registered. You can register one from the wallet unlock component.
webauthn.note: Note: Deleting a WebAuthn credential does not affect your accounts. It will only remove the option to unlock using that credential. You can always unlock using your password or register a new WebAuthn credential.

database.title: Stored Data
database.dangerDesc: Delete all locally stored data. This action is IRREVERSIBLE.
database.warningList1: All your accounts and private keys
database.warningList6: All data in localStorage and sessionStorage
database.warningRecovery: You will not be able to recover this data unless you have your recovery phrases (mnemonic).
database.confirmDesc: This action is IRREVERSIBLE. All your data will be permanently deleted.
database.lastWarning: Last warning: This action will delete all your data and redirect you to onboarding. Only do this if you are sure.
database.deleteSuccess: All data has been successfully deleted

backup.title: Backup and Import
backup.description: Export or import all your data (accounts, contacts, configurations)
backup.exportDesc: Download a JSON file with all your data
backup.exportOptionsHelp: By default only metadata is included (smaller file). Check these options to include complete images and PDFs (larger file).
backup.exportErrorDesc: Check the console for more details.
backup.fileIncludes: The file will include: accounts, WebAuthn credentials, contacts, API configurations, logs and documents
backup.importDesc: Restore data from a backup file
backup.selectFileHelp: Select a JSON backup file to restore your data
backup.passwordRequired: Password is required to import encrypted accounts
backup.wrongPassword: Incorrect password. Please verify the password you used when exporting the backup.
backup.confirmDesc: Review the data that will be imported and select options
backup.importOptionsDesc: Select which data to overwrite if it already exists
backup.backupPasswordPlaceholder: Password used when exporting the backup
backup.backupPasswordHelp: This is the password you used to protect your accounts when you created or exported them. It is needed to decrypt and use the imported accounts.
backup.importWarning: Warning: If you do not select "Overwrite", existing data will be kept and only new data will be imported. If you select "Overwrite", backup data will replace existing data.
backup.importSuccessNoData: No new data imported (may already exist)
